document_data.name: Flo Minsydel
document_data.mainbody:
'''Flo Minsydel''' was an inhabitant of [[Baldur's Gate]]'s [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|''Still here? Hit the bricks, I'm not looking for company.''|Flo Minsydel}}
document_data.Description: Flo was a [[human]] woman with a fair skin tone and shortly-cut blonde hair. She wore a frilled white blouse and a [[corset]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Flo Minsydel frequented [[The Singing Lute]] tavern overlooking the [[Gray Harbor]] and the [[Counting House]]. The unfriendly woman could be found sitting at one of the outside tables, sharp declining company and conversation from strangers.
